intro: Alectra barbata, commonly known as the barbed alectra, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, barbed bracts that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and prairies. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Alectra barbata is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to partial shade to full sun conditions.
